node.title: Floods kill at least six people in Indonesia as thick mud hampers relief efforts
node.description: Flash flooding caused byÂ torrential rains on Indonesia's main island of Java have killed at least six people, with three others missing.
node.content:
["Flash flooding caused by\u00a0torrential rains has\u00a0killed at least six people\u00a0on Indonesia's main island of Java,\u00a0and three others are missing.", "The country's National Disaster Mitigation Agency (NDMA) said rivers on the slopes of Mount Arjuno broke their banks on Thursday and muddy waters inundated five townships in Kota Batu, a city in East Java province.", "The agency said 15 people were swept away and six were later rescued.", "Agency chief\u00a0Ganip Warsito\u00a0said heavy rains were expected to continue and increase in intensity until February, partly because of a La Ni\u00f1a weather pattern.", "Rescuers retrieved a body near the Brantas River basin late on Thursday and five more bodies were found on Friday, NDMA acting spokesman Abdul Muhari said in a statement.", "", "
Authorities are starting to evacuate residents of affected areas.(AP: Trisnadi)
", "Crews were still searching for the three missing people, he said.", "Relief efforts were hampered by blocked roads covered with thick mud and debris.", "Photos and videos released by the agency showed a damaged bridge, and houses and cars covered in thick mud.", "", "
Thick mud is making it difficult for relief efforts to reach Kota Batu.(AP: Trisnadi)
", "Authorities were beginning to move people in affected areas to government shelters, Mr Muhari said.", "", "
Heavy rains often cause flooding in Indonesia.(AP: Trisnadi)
", "Severe flooding was also reported in other areas of the country but there were no casualties, the agency said.", "Seasonal rains frequently cause flooding and landslides in Indonesia, an archipelago of 17,000 islands where millions of people live in mountainous areas or near fertile flood plains.", "The last\u00a0major floods were in April, when Tropical Cyclone Seroja triggered landslides and flooding that killed at least 183 people on Indonesia's side of Timor Island, which the country shares with East Timor.", "Another 42 people were found dead on East Timor's side of the island.", "The cyclone damaged thousands of homes and thousands of people were displaced.", "AP"]
